note.p: Education: Pupil of Marcell Malpighi (FRS 1669) at Bologna; BA, MB (1678)

Career: Superintendent of the Waters of Bologna (1686); Professor of Hydrodynamics, Bologna (1693); helped Gian Domenico Cassini (FRS 1672) and Jacques Cassini (FRS 1698) to reconstruct the meridian at San Petronio, Bologna (1695); Curator of the Museo Aldrovandi in succession to Silvestro Bonfigliuoli (FRS 1696) (1696); Professor of Mathematics, Padua (1698); Professor of Theoretical Medicine, Padua (1702); published the works of Malpighi
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; IBI; Adelmann; Fantuzzi
References: Marta Cavazza, 'The Institute of Science of Bologna and the Royal Society in the eighteenth century' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 3-25, plate
